A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This was an insult to Star Wars fans. I have no idea what the studio was thinking. The story was a mess\, it ignored the momentum of the first and vastly superior film\, the humour was cliche and childish\, and the writing in general was awful. Why would the director ignore Mark Hamil when he said that Luke was out of character? I'm baffled by so many of the choices made in this film. The book sea cow monsters scene was like spitting in the audience's face. The Kylo and Rey scenes were good and made it watchable\, but the rest was just plain poor.
